review: Forever Reign is a stunning sequel to Long Live! Packed with political intrigue, elemental magic, romance, and sacrifice, the story picks up months after the events on the beach of Iona. Sebastian strives to repair the damage to his kingdom while the Elementals grapple with life without their magic. As a mission emerges to halt the natural disasters ravaging the kingdoms, the narrative builds to a thrilling conclusion for The Elementals of Iona.

Forever Reign is more character-driven than Long Live, delving into how the beach events have impacted each character and their futures. I appreciated the time spent with the cast, particularly the emphasis on platonic friendships. Sebastian's perspective added depth to the narrative, and his character development was a standout element.

The author has crafted an exceptional duology that encompasses all my favorite elements: mystery, elemental magic, romance, humor, and the theme of found family. With something for everyone, this series comes highly recommended.
conclusion: Forever Reign is a brilliant conclusion to The Elementals of Iona duology, delivering a character-driven narrative filled with political intrigue, elemental magic, romance, and humor. The author masterfully explores the aftermath of the events in *Long Live*, deepening the characters and their relationships. The book is a must-read, offering a satisfying and emotional conclusion.
